intro: Altingia yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan alder, is a deciduous tree native to China. It belongs to the family Tutsanaceae and is characterized by its slender, often multi-stemmed trunk and alternate, simple leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by woody fruits containing three to four seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Altingia yunnanensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
